circumstances: Leonard Smith, referred to as MP, was reported missing after failing to return home on his regular commute from Discovery Quay, Dundee. Concern grew when Anne McKenzie, a colleague, mentioned that Leonard had been discussing some unusual events involving a group rumored to operate from a discreet location near a military base at 71 Lothian Crescent, Dundee. Prior to his disappearance, Leonard had expressed interest in the local history, particularly stories surrounding an enigmatic cult, which was rumored to hold gatherings in attics around the area. On the day he was last seen, MP was believed to have visited such a cult location, which might have been at 31 Step Row, Dundee. After an intensive search by the police, Leonard was eventually located unharmed in Forfar, although he remained tight-lipped about the events during his absence.

q_17_explanation: MP's behavior was unusual as he pursued possible involvement with a cult.
q_20_explanation: He intended to explore a cult location but did not return home.

circumstances: Leonard Smith, known to his friends and family for his dedication to charity work, was reported missing from his residence on Dundee Road, Arbroath. Initial communications on the day of his disappearance indicated he had plans to attend evening classes. However, he never arrived at 71 Lothian Crescent in Dundee, the location where the sessions were held. His close friend, Ashleigh Stephenson, mentioned Leonard had been contemplating a more meaningful engagement with communities, potentially hinting at plans to forge his own path away from daily routines. Despite low concern levels at first due to his independent nature and low-risk assessment, as days passed without word, his father grew increasingly anxious. Gerard, also a part of Leonard’s circle, helped coordinate efforts to retrace his steps. Ultimately, Leonard was located by the police at an acquaintance's house at Panmure Terrace, seeming intent on rejuvenating and refocusing his life's vision.
